commits.subject: Merge pull request #37 from devmade-ai/claude/setup-gh-cli-auth-AcLWM
commits.body: feat: add GitHub CLI setup script for API extraction
commits.title: Merge pull request #37 from devmade-ai/claude/setup-gh-cli-auth-AcLWM

commits.subject: feat: add .env file support for GH_TOKEN authentication
commits.body:
Enable API extraction to work in AI sessions and non-interactive
environments by supporting GH_TOKEN via .env file.

Changes:
- Add .env.example template with GH_TOKEN configuration
- Update extract-api.js to load .env and use GH_TOKEN
- Update setup-gh.sh with --save-env flag and .env support
- Add .env to .gitignore (secrets shouldn't be committed)

Authentication priority:
1. GH_TOKEN environment variable
2. .env file in project root
3. gh auth login (interactive)

This enables AI assistants to use API extraction by simply creating
a .env file with their GitHub token.
commits.title: add .env file support for GH_TOKEN authentication

commits.subject: feat: add GitHub CLI setup script for API extraction
commits.body:
Add scripts/setup-gh.sh to automate GitHub CLI installation and
authentication across different environments (Linux, macOS, WSL).

- Detects OS and uses appropriate package manager
- Supports interactive (browser) and non-interactive (token) auth
- Verifies API access after authentication
- Updates documentation with setup instructions

This enables the untested extract-api.js to be properly configured
and tested from any environment.
commits.title: add GitHub CLI setup script for API extraction

commits.subject: Merge pull request #36 from devmade-ai/claude/optimize-feeding-process-SNCIW
commits.body: feat: add merge-analysis.js for optimized feed workflow
commits.title: Merge pull request #36 from devmade-ai/claude/optimize-feeding-process-SNCIW

commits.subject: docs: add AI_LESSONS.md for tracking AI mistakes
commits.body:
Created dedicated file to document AI oversights and mistakes so future
sessions can learn from them. Added to session start checklist in
CLAUDE.md.

First entry: Building extract-api.js without ability to test it.
commits.title: add AI_LESSONS.md for tracking AI mistakes

commits.subject: docs: add warnings about untested API extraction feature
commits.body:
extract-api.js was built but never successfully tested because it
requires gh CLI authentication. Added prominent warnings to TODO.md
and SESSION_NOTES.md so future AI sessions know to use --clone flag
until the API extraction is properly tested.
commits.title: add warnings about untested API extraction feature

commits.subject: fix: correct playbook file structure and hatch flow
commits.body:
- File structure: reports/ has commits/ not batches/
- Hatch flow: now uses pending.js like feed (not reports/batches/)
- Key differences table: updated to reflect unified batch source
- Step numbers: adjusted for new pending.js step in hatch
commits.title: correct playbook file structure and hatch flow

commits.subject: fix: write failed analysis to needs-reprocess.json
commits.body:
merge-analysis.js now tracks failures like save-commit.js:
- Writes to processed/<repo>/needs-reprocess.json
- Includes attempt count for repeated failures
- Preserves the failed analysis for debugging
commits.title: write failed analysis to needs-reprocess.json

commits.subject: docs: update ADMIN_GUIDE with API-based extraction info
commits.title: update ADMIN_GUIDE with API-based extraction info

commits.subject: feat: add API-based extraction (no cloning required)
commits.body:
- extract-api.js fetches commit data via GitHub API
- update-all.sh defaults to API mode, --clone for old behavior
- Faster setup, no disk space for clones, works without git installed

Requires: gh CLI installed and authenticated
commits.title: add API-based extraction (no cloning required)

commits.subject: feat: add merge-analysis.js for optimized feed workflow
commits.body:
AI now outputs only analysis fields (sha, tags, complexity, urgency, impact)
instead of full commit objects. Script merges with raw git data from reports/.

Token savings: ~10x reduction per commit (50-80 vs 500-800 tokens)
commits.title: add merge-analysis.js for optimized feed workflow

commits.subject: refactor: improve tab naming and section ordering
commits.body:
Tab renames for clarity:
- "Work" → "Breakdown" (clearer - breaking down by type/tags/people)
- "Health" → "Risk" (accurate - it's about urgency/impact/security)

Risk tab reordering:
- Move Security-Related Commits to top (most actionable item first)
- Urgency/Impact sections follow

Work Hours Settings:
- Convert to collapsible section (collapsed by default)
- It's config, not content - shouldn't take visual priority
commits.title: improve tab naming and section ordering

commits.subject: feat: add dashboard footer with data summary
commits.body:
- Add footer showing commit count, date range, and load timestamp
- Example: "698 commits · Jan 2024 – Jan 2025 · Data loaded Jan 22, 2025 3:45 PM"
- Styled subtly with muted text and top border
- Provides consistent bottom spacing across all tabs
commits.title: add dashboard footer with data summary

commits.subject: fix: move chart legends to bottom to prevent overflow
commits.body:
- Tags chart: Move legend from right to bottom position
- Work Breakdown chart: Move legend from right to bottom position
- Add custom legend labels showing tag name + count
- Increase container heights to accommodate bottom legends
  - tags-chart: h-64 → h-80
  - summary-breakdown-chart: h-48 → h-56
- Style legend with smaller font (11px) and compact padding
commits.title: move chart legends to bottom to prevent overflow

commits.subject: feat: expand tag colors with presets and dynamic fallback
commits.body:
- Add 30+ preset tag colors for common conventional commit types:
  - Green family: feature, enhancement, seed, init
  - Red family: bugfix, fix, security, hotfix
  - Orange/amber: removal, revert, deprecate
  - Purple family: refactor, naming, cleanup
  - Yellow: test, test-unit, test-e2e
  - Orange: build, ci, deploy
  - Slate: config, chore
  - Pink family: style, ux, ui, accessibility
  - Cyan: performance, perf
  - Lime: dependency, deps

- Add hash-based dynamic color generation for unknown tags
  - Uses 10-color palette optimized for dark backgrounds
  - Same tag always gets same color (consistent hashing)
  - No more gray fallback for unrecognized tags

- Update all tag rendering to use dynamic styles
commits.title: expand tag colors with presets and dynamic fallback

commits.subject: fix: additional overflow and visibility fixes
commits.body:
- Repo filter: Change display from 'flex' to 'block' so label appears above dropdown
- Detail pane: Add visibility:hidden to prevent showing when closed
- Work Hours: Add flex-wrap and whitespace-nowrap for mobile overflow
commits.title: additional overflow and visibility fixes

commits.subject: fix: resolve overflow and wrapping issues in dashboard
commits.body:
- Stats cards: Change grid from 3-col to 1-col on mobile (sm:grid-cols-3)
- Stats labels: Add .stat-label class with responsive sizing
- Tabs bar: Add min-w-0 and flex-shrink-0 for proper overflow scrolling
- Filter select: Remove min-width constraint to prevent overflow
- Tabs bar: Add overflow:hidden to container
commits.title: resolve overflow and wrapping issues in dashboard

commits.subject: fix: reprocess 65 malformed commits with complete git metadata
commits.body:
Added fix-malformed.js script that:
- Clones repos to extract git metadata (timestamp, author, subject, etc.)
- Merges with existing analysis (tags, complexity, urgency, impact)
- Saves complete commit objects

All 65 previously malformed commits are now fixed:
- model-pear: 53 commits
- repo-tor: 11 commits
- social-ad-creator: 1 commit

Total commits now: 763 (was 698 with 65 skipped)

https://claude.ai/code/session_01GTJnfM2q8ybazZtZ1Y54fg
commits.title: reprocess 65 malformed commits with complete git metadata

commits.subject: chore: regenerate dashboard data (698 valid commits)
commits.body: https://claude.ai/code/session_01GTJnfM2q8ybazZtZ1Y54fg
commits.title: regenerate dashboard data (698 valid commits)

commits.subject: fix: capture validation failures for reprocessing instead of skipping
commits.body:
Both scripts now write malformed commits to needs-reprocess.json files
instead of silently skipping them:

save-commit.js:
- Validates all required fields before saving
- Valid commits are saved, invalid ones written to needs-reprocess.json
- Exits with error if any commits failed validation
- Clear error messages explaining what went wrong

aggregate-processed.js:
- Loudly reports all malformed commits during aggregation
- Writes them to processed/<repo>/needs-reprocess.json
- Shows warning at end of output

This ensures validation failures are visible and actionable rather
than silently lost.

https://claude.ai/code/session_01GTJnfM2q8ybazZtZ1Y54fg
commits.title: capture validation failures for reprocessing instead of skipping

commits.subject: fix: add validation to save-commit.js to prevent incomplete saves
commits.body:
Root cause of malformed commits: when AI analyzed batches, it only
output analysis fields instead of complete commit objects. Without
validation, these incomplete commits were saved to processed/.

Now save-commit.js validates:
- Required metadata: sha, timestamp, subject
- Required author: author_id or author
- Required analysis: tags, complexity, urgency, impact

Fails fast with clear error message if any fields are missing.

https://claude.ai/code/session_01GTJnfM2q8ybazZtZ1Y54fg
commits.title: add validation to save-commit.js to prevent incomplete saves

commits.subject: fix: skip malformed commits and add defensive null checks
commits.body:
Dashboard was breaking because 65 processed commits were missing required
fields (timestamp, author_id). JavaScript errors halted execution before
the compare dropdown event listener was attached.

Changes:
- aggregate-processed.js: Add validateCommit() to skip incomplete commits
- dashboard/index.html: Add null guard in getWorkPattern() for timestamps
- dashboard/index.html: Add renderSummary() on Overview tab switch

Skipped commits: model-pear (53), repo-tor (11), social-ad-creator (1)

https://claude.ai/code/session_01GTJnfM2q8ybazZtZ1Y54fg
commits.title: skip malformed commits and add defensive null checks

commits.subject: fix: remove orphaned stat-top-tag code breaking dashboard stats
commits.body:
The dashboard was showing 0 for Contributors, Features Built, and Bugs Fixed because JavaScript was trying to set elements that no longer existed in the HTML after a previous layout change.

- Remove stat-top-tag code from updateSummaryStats()
- Update PDF export from 4 to 3 column layout
- This fixes the TypeError that was halting script execution

commits.subject: Merge pull request #31 from devmade-ai/claude/implement-koinz-style-guide-KIfQY
commits.body: feat: implement Koinz Style Guide for dashboard

commits.subject: feat: implement Koinz Style Guide for dashboard
commits.body:
Complete visual redesign following the Koinz Style Guide specification:

- Dark-only theme with Koinz color palette (#1B1B1B background, #2a2a2a cards, #2D68FF primary)
- Figtree font family loaded from Google Fonts
- 8px base spacing system
- Updated border radius (4px/8px/12px for sm/md/lg)
- Redesigned components: cards, buttons, inputs, tags, badges
- Chart.js colors updated to match Koinz palette
- Removed light mode toggle (dark-only mode)
- Modal backdrop uses rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.8)
- Tags/badges use transparent backgrounds with colored borders

commits.subject: Merge pull request #30 from devmade-ai/claude/fix-spacing-reorder-sections-L1brs
commits.body: fix: consistent section spacing across all dashboard tabs

commits.subject: feat: redesign dashboard layout with sticky tabs and filter sidebar
commits.body:
- Add sticky tabs bar that stays visible when scrolling
- Create collapsible filter sidebar (collapsed by default)
  - Desktop: pushes content when expanded
  - Mobile: overlays as slide-out panel
- Move global summary cards into Overview tab
  - Add Files Changed, Avg Complexity, Contributors to Overview
  - Remove redundant Top Work Type (shown in Work Breakdown chart)
- Add filter badge indicator on toggle button when filters active

commits.subject: fix: consistent section spacing across all dashboard tabs
commits.body: Add mb-6 spacing to sections that precede other tab-content containers when displayed together (Work tab shows progress + contributors + tags, Activity tab shows activity + timing).

commits.subject: fix: remove orphaned updateFilteredStats() causing console errors
commits.body:
The function referenced a non-existent 'stat-commits-filtered' element, throwing TypeError on every filter change. The functionality was already handled by updateFilterIndicator().

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>

commits.subject: Merge pull request #29 from devmade-ai/claude/fix-overview-filters-g2Sdz
commits.body: fix: remove broken security-count reference in renderSecurity()

commits.subject: fix: remove broken security-count reference in renderSecurity()
commits.body:
The renderSecurity() function was trying to update a non-existent element 'security-count', causing a TypeError that stopped execution of applyFilters(). Since renderSummary() is called after renderSecurity() in applyFilters(), the Overview tab never updated when filters changed.

The security count is already correctly handled by renderHealth() via the 'health-security-count' element, so the broken line was simply removed.

commits.subject: Merge pull request #28 from devmade-ai/claude/fix-filter-updates-4hRgv
commits.body: fix: filter and compare updates now apply to Overview tab

commits.subject: fix: filter and compare updates now apply to Overview tab
commits.body:
- Add getCurrentPeriodCommits() helper for dynamic filtered+period data
- Use initialization flags to prevent duplicate click handlers
- Overview cards (Features, Bugs, Urgency, Planned) now use dynamic data
- Health cards (Security, Reactive, Weekend, After Hours) now use dynamic data

Fixes issue where filters and Compare dropdown didn't affect Overview tab.

commits.subject: feat: improve UI consistency across dashboard
commits.body:
- Add collapsible sections with persistent state (default collapsed)
- Standardize text colors with themed CSS variables
- Standardize spacing with consistent gaps and margins
- Ensure consistent tag colors and display using getTagClass()
- Add dark mode improvements for themed backgrounds

commits.subject: fix: include Health tab in re-render on tab switch
commits.body: Extended the Chart.js hidden container fix to also re-render the Health tab (urgency trend, impact over time charts) when switching to that tab.

commits.subject: fix: re-render charts when switching to Activity/Work tabs
commits.body: Chart.js cannot render to hidden containers (zero width/height). Added re-render calls in tab click handler to fix empty charts on Activity tab (heatmap, hour/day charts) and Work tab (tags).

commits.subject: Merge pull request #25 from devmade-ai/claude/review-dashboard-commits-XgWku
commits.body: fix: dashboard Files Changed showing 0

commits.subject: fix: apply author identity mapping in aggregation
commits.body:
The author-map.json config existed but wasn't being used during data aggregation. Now the aggregate script:

- Loads config/author-map.json at startup
- Resolves raw emails to canonical author IDs
- Normalizes author_id in all commits
- Merges contributor stats by canonical ID
- Includes metadata.authors for dashboard resolution

Result: jacotheron87's two email addresses are now properly merged into a single contributor (4 total instead of 5).

commits.subject: feat: global filters across all dashboard tabs
commits.body:
- Move filter bar above tabs (always visible)
- Add filter indicator showing "X of Y" when active
- Apply filters to all tabs (Work, Health, etc.) not just Activity
- Update all render functions to use getFilteredCommits()
- Preserve filter state across repo switches with validation

Previously filters only affected the commit list on the Activity tab. Now all charts, stats, and breakdowns respect the active filters.

commits.subject: fix: normalize data field formats in dashboard
commits.body:
Add helper functions to handle inconsistent field formats:
- getCommitSubject(): handles subject vs message
- getAdditions(): handles stats.additions vs lines_added
- getDeletions(): handles stats.deletions vs lines_deleted

This ensures all 576 commits display correctly regardless of which extraction format they came from.

commits.subject: fix: dashboard Files Changed showing 0
commits.body:
Add getFilesChanged() helper to handle multiple data formats:
- stats.filesChanged (new extractions)
- files_changed (snake_case, older commits)

Now correctly shows 1,689 files changed across 576 commits.

commits.subject: refactor: migrate from batch files to individual commit files
commits.body:
Store each analyzed commit as a separate JSON file instead of batching 15 commits per file. This simplifies deduplication (file existence = processed), enables atomic edits, and produces cleaner git diffs.

Changes:
- Add scripts/save-commit.js for saving individual commits
- Add scripts/migrate-batches-to-commits.js for one-time migration
- Update scripts/aggregate-processed.js to read from commits/
- Update scripts/extract.js to write individual commit files
- Migrate all 4 repos (576 commits total)
- Delete old batches/ directories

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>

commits.subject: feat: add save-batch.js for faster batch processing
commits.body:
- New script writes batch file + updates manifest in one step
- Avoids IDE approval dialogs that slow down long sessions
- Updated EXTRACTION_PLAYBOOK.md with new workflow
- Includes recent batch processing progress

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>

commits.subject: feat: implement Dashboard V2 with 4-tab structure and urgency/impact visualizations
commits.body:
Major dashboard restructure:
- 4 tabs (Overview, Activity, Work, Health) down from 7
- TAB_MAPPING in JS shows multiple content containers per tab
- Existing render functions continue to work unchanged

New visualizations in Health tab:
- Operational health cards (Security, Reactive%, Weekend%, After Hours%)
- Urgency Distribution bars (Planned/Normal/Reactive)
- Impact Distribution bars (user-facing/internal/infra/api)

commits.subject: feat: add aggregation script for processed data with urgency/impact
commits.body:
New script reads AI-analyzed commits from processed/<repo>/batches/
and generates dashboard-ready JSON with full aggregations:

- tagBreakdown, complexityBreakdown (existing)
- urgencyBreakdown, impactBreakdown (NEW)
- Monthly aggregations with avgUrgency, impact distribution
- Contributor aggregations with avgUrgency, impactBreakdown

Output structure:
- dashboard/data.json (overall, all repos combined)
- dashboard/repos/<repo>.json (per-repo, same schema)

Both views use identical schema enabling consistent dashboard code.
commits.title: add aggregation script for processed data with urgency/impact

commits.subject: docs: complete Dashboard V2 design specification
commits.body:
New hybrid dashboard architecture combining logical groupings with
contextual detail pane. Reduces cognitive load (4 tabs instead of 7)
while enabling in-context drill-down.

Key design decisions:
- Overview/Activity/Work/Health tab structure
- Detail pane slides out on click (preserves context)
- Same data schema for overall and per-repo views
- Urgency and Impact dimensions integrated throughout

Files:
- DASHBOARD_V2_DESIGN.md: Full design spec with layouts and schemas
- SESSION_NOTES.md: Updated current state and next actions
- TODO.md: Reorganized for V2 implementation priorities
- HISTORY.md: Added design session entry
commits.title: complete Dashboard V2 design specification

commits.subject: docs: update documentation for manifest-based tracking system
commits.body:
- SESSION_NOTES.md: Update progress (240/608 commits processed), add new
  scripts (pending.js, manifest-update.js) to key files, explain
  manifest-based tracking benefits
- HISTORY.md: Add entry documenting manifest-based incremental processing
  feature - the problem, solution, workflow, and files changed
commits.title: update documentation for manifest-based tracking system

commits.subject: feat: add incremental processing support for "feed the chicken"
commits.body:
Add manifest-based tracking to enable resumable batch processing:
- scripts/pending.js: Generates pending batches by comparing manifests
  against extracted commits. Supports --rebuild-manifests flag.
- scripts/manifest-update.js: Updates manifest after batch approval
- processed/<repo>/manifest.json: Tracks processed SHAs (source of truth)
- pending/<repo>/batches/: Generated batches of unprocessed commits only

This allows "feed the chicken" to work correctly even after merging
and starting a new session - only truly new/unprocessed commits will
be presented for review.

Updated EXTRACTION_PLAYBOOK.md with new workflow documentation.
commits.title: add incremental processing support for "feed the chicken"

commits.subject: docs: align commit convention with urgency and impact dimensions
commits.body:
Updated COMMIT_CONVENTION.md to match the extraction playbook schema:

- Added urgency/impact to commit message format
- New "Optional: Metadata Footers" section explaining usage
- Expanded "Metadata Indicators" section with urgency and impact tables
- Updated all examples to demonstrate the new fields
- Added optional items to commit checklist

Ensures manual commits can include the same metadata that AI analysis assigns.

commits.subject: feat: add urgency and impact dimensions to commit analysis schema
commits.body:
Two new dimensions for richer commit insights:

Urgency (1-5): How critical was the change?
- Captures reactive vs planned work patterns
- Helps identify operational health (high urgency = problems)

Impact (internal/user-facing/infrastructure/api): Who is affected?
- Shows where effort goes
- Distinguishes building vs maintaining vs supporting

Updated EXTRACTION_PLAYBOOK.md with guidelines, examples, and schema.

- social-ad-creator: 156 commits (16 batches)
- model-pear: 302 commits (31 batches)

Total: 604 commits across 63 batches ready for AI analysis.

commits.body:
Updated COMMIT_CONVENTION.md to use the same 55+ tag system
from EXTRACTION_PLAYBOOK.md. Commits now use multiple tags
in footer for consistent analysis between manual commits
and AI-analyzed historical commits.

Updated commit-msg hook to encourage (not require) tags.

commits.subject: chore: add data cleanup strategy to playbook
commits.body:
- Add reports/*/batches/ to .gitignore (working files, regenerated)
- Document what's committed vs gitignored in playbook
- Update clean slate step to delete all extracted data
- Clarify what's preserved during reset (config, dashboard UI)

commits.subject: docs: simplify SESSION_NOTES for future sessions
commits.body:
- Removed outdated history (moved to git log)
- Focus on current state and @data workflow
- Quick reference for extraction triggers and commands
- Progress tracking table for batch processing
- Key files reference

commits.subject: docs: comprehensive 55+ tag list for commit analysis
commits.body:
Expanded from 11 generic tags to 55+ specific tags across categories:
- User-facing: feature, enhancement, bugfix, hotfix, ui, ux, accessibility, i18n, localization
- Code: refactor, simplify, removal, deprecation, migration, naming, types
- Performance: performance, memory, caching
- Security: security, auth, authorization, vulnerability, sanitization
- Testing: test-unit, test-integration, test-e2e, test-fix, coverage, mocks
- Docs: docs, changelog, comments, api-docs, examples
- Infra: ci, cd, docker, monitoring, hosting
- Build: build, bundler, config, env, lint, formatter
- Deps: dependency-add, dependency-update, dependency-remove, dependency-security
- Database: database, schema, data-migration, seed
- API: api, api-breaking, endpoint
- Git: merge, revert, release, init
- Style: style, imports, whitespace
- Errors: error-handling, logging, validation

AI reads full commit body and assigns ALL applicable tags.

commits.subject: chore: re-extract chatty-chart with batch files
feat: add batch file output for AI review tracking
commits.body:
- extract.js now creates batches/ folder with batch-NNN.json files (10 commits each)
- Playbook updated with batch file workflow:
  - reports/<repo>/batches/ = raw extracted batches
  - processed/<repo>/batches/ = approved batches with AI tags
  - Progress = compare file lists between folders
- Removes checkpoint.json in favor of batch file tracking
- Clear verification: can't skip or redo batches

- "feed the chicken" resumes from checkpoint if incomplete

commits.subject: refactor: new extraction architecture with two triggers
commits.body:

- "feed the chicken" = incremental, AI analyzes only NEW commits
- processed/ folder is source of truth (persistent)
- reports/ folder removed (was ephemeral)
- Deleted scripts/tag-commits.js (AI analyzes directly)

commits.subject: refactor: separate script extraction from AI tagging
commits.body:
Scripts now extract raw data only (empty tags, null complexity):
- extract.js: Removes tag parsing logic, outputs tags: [], complexity: null
- aggregate.js: Passes through empty tags (no 'other' default)

AI (@data persona) will analyze each commit and assign:
- tags[] based on playbook guidelines
- complexity (1-5) based on files changed + tag count

Updated EXTRACTION_PLAYBOOK.md with new two-stage process.

commits.body:
Audit and cleanup - removed every element that shows meaningless counts:

Progress Tab:
- Remove: Monthly Commit Volume, Cumulative Lines charts
- Add: Complexity Over Time chart

Contributors Tab (complete rework):
- Remove: Commits by Contributor, Lines by Contributor charts
- Remove: Contributor Details list
- Add: "Who Does What" - work type breakdown per person
- Add: Complexity by Contributor chart

Timeline Tab:
- Remove: Commit Timeline chart
- Remove: +/- lines from commit display
- Add: Complexity badge on each commit

Summary Tab:
- Remove: "Top Contributor", "Busiest Day" highlights
- Remove: "Avg commits/day" stat
- Add: "Complex Changes", "Quality Work" highlights

Dashboard now shows only meaningful work metrics:
what kind of work, who does what, and how complex it is.

commits.subject: refactor: replace vanity metrics with meaningful work metrics
commits.body:
Remove commits/lines focus, add metrics that actually matter:

Summary Cards:
- Lines Added → Files Changed (scope)
- Lines Removed → Avg Complexity (1-5)
- Commits → Top Work Type (focus)

Executive Summary:
- Commits → Features Built
- Contributors → Bugs Fixed
- Add Complexity + Files Touched with trends

The dashboard now shows what kind of work is being done,
how complex it is, and how much of the codebase is affected -
not vanity metrics like line counts.

commits.subject: feat: add PDF export and shareable links (Priority 4)
commits.body:
Add export/share capabilities to the dashboard:

- PDF Export: Generate downloadable PDF of current tab view
  - Uses html2pdf.js for client-side generation
  - Includes header, stats, and chart content
  - Landscape A4 format with loading feedback

- Shareable Links: Copy URL with encoded state
  - Captures tab, filters, period, timezone settings
  - Auto-applies URL state on page load
  - Toast notifications for user feedback

- UI: Header buttons (Share + Export PDF)
  - Responsive layout (icons on mobile)
  - Buttons appear after data loads

Completes all Discovery Session priorities (1-4).

commits.subject: feat: implement tag-based extraction with complexity scoring
commits.body:
Phase 1 - extract.js:
- Add CONVENTIONAL_TO_TAG mapping (feat→feature, fix→bugfix, etc.)
- parseCommitMessage() returns tags[] array instead of single type
- Add calculateComplexity() function (1-5 scale)
- Summary outputs tagBreakdown and complexityBreakdown
- Contributors/files track tagCounts instead of types

Phase 4 - aggregate.js:
- Tag-aware aggregation with tagCounts
- Summary outputs tagBreakdown and complexityBreakdown
- Monthly aggregation tracks tags per month

Data regenerated for repo-tor with new format.
Docs updated (USER_GUIDE, HISTORY, SESSION_NOTES, TODO).

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>

commits.subject: feat: add multi-tag support to dashboard
commits.body:
- Replace single type field with tags[] array model
- Add TAG_COLORS and tag helper functions (getCommitTags, getAllTags, getTagColor, getTagClass)
- Rename "Type" filter to "Tag" filter (matches any tag)
- Show all tags on commits (up to 3 with overflow indicator)
- Rename "By Type" tab to "By Tag" tab
- Update Progress tab Feature vs Bug Fix for tag-based counting
- Update combineDataFiles() to build tagBreakdown

Dashboard expects tags[] field - will show "other" until extraction is updated.

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>

commits.subject: docs: refocus on tag-based analytics with AI-driven extraction
commits.body:
Shift tool focus to three core metrics:
- When: timestamp analytics (hour, day, work hours, weekends)
- What: AI-analyzed tags from commit messages (multiple per commit)
- Complexity: score based on files changed + tag count

Add EXTRACTION_PLAYBOOK.md with "feed the chicken" trigger phrase.

Remove completed items from TODO (tracked in HISTORY.md).

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>

commits.subject: Merge pull request #9 from devmade-ai/claude/add-todo-timestamp-views-9u4BW
commits.body: docs: add feature roadmap for timestamp views, filters, design, and privacy

commits.subject: docs: add research items for commit model improvements
commits.body:
New Research/Investigation section in TODO.md:

1. Device/Platform Attribution
   - Split contributions by committer name (mobile vs desktop)
   - Config mapping for name variations with device tags

2. AI-Powered Commit Categorization
   - Claude reads commit messages + diffs to understand intent
   - Auto-tagging beyond conventional commit types
   - Confidence scores and human override

3. Multi-Tag Commit Model
   - One commit can have multiple tags (feat + refactor + docs)
   - Schema change from single type to tags[] with weights
   - Backward compatibility with existing data

4. Tag-Centric Reporting
   - Shift focus from commit counts to accomplishments
   - Effort weighting based on complexity
   - Activity vs output distinction

commits.subject: feat: add multi-repo management with config and update script
commits.body:
- Created config/repos.json to track repository URLs
- Created scripts/update-all.sh to automate extraction/aggregation
- Updated ADMIN_GUIDE.md with managed repos workflow
- Simplified .gitignore: track all reports/, ignore .repo-cache/
- Updated SESSION_NOTES.md and HISTORY.md

Repos can now be added to config once and re-extracted anytime
by running: ./scripts/update-all.sh

- repo-tor: 32 commits

Dashboard will now auto-load all repo data on open.

commits.subject: Merge pull request #4 from devmade-ai/claude/fix-dashboard-mobile-tabs-pRUVw
commits.body: fix: make dashboard tabs mobile-friendly with horizontal scroll

commits.subject: feat: change timeline to horizontal bar chart
commits.body:
- Switched from vertical columns to horizontal bars
- Newest dates at top for natural reading
- Better mobile UX with more room for date labels

commits.subject: fix: improve timeline layout for mobile devices
commits.body:
- Filter bar: responsive grid (2-col mobile, 3-col tablet, flex desktop)
- Stacked filter labels above inputs for better touch targets
- Shorter chart height on mobile (h-48 vs h-64)
- Commit list: message wraps on mobile, metadata flows with separators
- Line counts show inline on desktop, below metadata on mobile

commits.subject: fix: make dashboard tabs mobile-friendly with horizontal scroll
commits.body:
Added overflow-x-auto and hidden scrollbar for clean horizontal
scrolling on mobile devices. Applied whitespace-nowrap to prevent
tab text wrapping and used negative margin for edge-to-edge scroll.

commits.subject: fix: include data.json in GitHub Pages deployment
commits.body:
The deploy workflow was copying dashboard/index.html but not
dashboard/data.json, causing 404 errors on the live site when
the dashboard tried to auto-load data.

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>

commits.body: docs: split documentation into user guide and admin guide

commits.subject: feat: implement schema alignment and multiple file loading
commits.body:
Schema Alignment:
- Add author_id field to commits (references metadata.authors)
- Replace parseMethod with is_conventional boolean
- Add authors map to metadata.json for author lookup
- Add security_events array to summary.json
- Wrap commits.json in { "commits": [...] } object
- Update aggregate.js to match new schema

Dashboard - Multiple Data Files:
- File picker accepts multiple files (HTML5 multiple attribute)
- Client-side combineDataFiles() function merges data
- Combines commits, contributors, files from multiple repos
- Merges authors from metadata of all files
- Shows repo filter when multiple repos loaded

Updated documentation:
- USER_GUIDE.md: Added Loading Data section with multi-file instructions
- TODO.md: Marked medium priority items as complete
- SESSION_NOTES.md: Updated current state
- HISTORY.md: Added schema alignment and multi-file entries

commits.subject: docs: update all documentation and re-extract data
commits.body:
Re-ran extraction to capture all 20 commits (was 18):
- reports/repo-tor/ now includes latest commits
- Extraction uses git log --all for all branches

Updated documentation:
- SESSION_NOTES.md: Current state with extraction details
- TODO.md: Added data extraction to completed items
- HISTORY.md: Added data extraction entry

commits.subject: chore: fix gitignore comment wording
chore: add extracted sample data for dashboard
commits.body:
Run extraction on this repository to provide sample data:
- 18 commits from 3 contributors
- Type breakdown: feat, docs, test, other, ci
- Data available at reports/repo-tor/data.json

Updated .gitignore to allow sample data while ignoring other reports.

commits.subject: ci: add GitHub Pages deployment workflow
commits.body:
Add automated deployment to GitHub Pages:
- .github/workflows/deploy.yml: Deploys on push to main/master
- Supports manual trigger via workflow_dispatch
- Copies dashboard and reports folder to _site

Updated ADMIN_GUIDE.md with setup instructions:
- Enable GitHub Pages with "GitHub Actions" as source
- Manual deployment via Actions tab

commits.subject: feat(dashboard): add filters for type, author, date range, and repo
commits.body:
Add filter bar to Timeline tab:
- Type dropdown to filter by commit type
- Author dropdown to filter by contributor
- Repo dropdown for aggregated data (auto-hides for single repo)
- Date range picker with from/to inputs
- Clear Filters button to reset all

Filters update both the timeline chart and commit list.
Added "Showing X of Y commits" counter.

commits.subject: feat(D3): add multi-repository aggregation script
commits.body:
Implement aggregation to combine data from multiple repositories:
- scripts/aggregate.js: Combines repo data with author identity mapping
- config/author-map.example.json: Example author mapping configuration
- config/author-map.schema.json: JSON schema for validation

Also adds repo_id support:
- scripts/extract.js: Now includes repo_id in metadata and commits
- Enables tracking commit source in aggregated views

Documentation updates:
- ADMIN_GUIDE.md: Added aggregation section
- USER_GUIDE.md: Added multi-repository view section
- TODO.md: Marked D3 as complete

commits.subject: docs: update CLAUDE.md checklist and TODO.md timestamp
commits.body:
- Add ADMIN_GUIDE.md to AI checklist for setup/config changes
- Clarify USER_GUIDE.md is for UI/interpretation changes
- Update TODO.md last-updated note to reflect session 3

commits.subject: docs: split documentation into user guide and admin guide
commits.body:
Separate concerns for different audiences:
- USER_GUIDE.md: Dashboard UI walkthrough, chart interpretation, metric
  analysis, health indicators, and tips for effective use
- ADMIN_GUIDE.md: Installation, data extraction, commit hooks setup,
  hosting options, and troubleshooting

User guide focuses on "what does this mean?" while admin guide
focuses on "how do I set this up?"

commits.subject: Merge pull request #1 from devmade-ai/claude/git-analytics-reporting-ebvnR
commits.body: Add Git Analytics Reporting System

commits.subject: docs: update README and CLAUDE.md with project context
commits.body:
- README.md: Add project description, features, quick start, structure
- CLAUDE.md: Add project overview section with purpose, components, state

commits.subject: docs: complete documentation for all features
commits.body:
- USER_GUIDE.md: Add commit convention section with hooks setup
- USER_TESTING.md: Add test scenarios for extraction, dashboard, hooks
- TODO.md: Add remaining work items (D3, schema alignment, filters)

commits.subject: docs: add commit convention guide and validation hooks
commits.body:
D2 deliverable - Commit Convention Guide:
- docs/COMMIT_CONVENTION.md: Full guide for conventional commits
  with type definitions, examples, and analytics impact
- .gitmessage: Git commit template for consistent formatting
- hooks/commit-msg: Validation hook for commit message format
- hooks/setup.sh: Installation script for git hooks

Run ./hooks/setup.sh to enable validation.

commits.subject: Add Git Analytics Reporting System
commits.body:
- scripts/extract.js: Node.js extraction script with git log parsing,
  conventional commit detection, keyword-based type fallback, and
  structured JSON output
- scripts/extract.sh: Shell wrapper for easier usage
- dashboard/index.html: Static analytics dashboard with Chart.js
  - Timeline: daily commit chart, recent commits list
  - Progress: monthly volume, cumulative growth, feature vs fix trends
  - Contributors: commits and lines by author
  - Security: highlighted security-related commits
  - Types: pie chart and percentage breakdown
- Updated .gitignore to exclude generated reports/
- Updated docs with usage documentation

commits.subject: Add USER_GUIDE.md and USER_TESTING.md to checklists
commits.body:
Updated "After Each Significant Task" checklist to include:
- Update USER_GUIDE.md when user-facing behavior changes
- Update USER_TESTING.md when new test scenarios are needed

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
